main event: Pilots reported sighting and following a flying saucer larger than their aircraft, northwest of Bethel, Alaska on August 4, 1947. The object was described as smooth-surfaced, streamlined, and black in color with no visible means of propulsion.
interesting points: The object was observed to be larger in mass than a C-54 aircraft and appeared in silhouette against a brilliant evening sky.
Pilots estimated its speed to be approximately three times that of their aircraft, indicating a very rapid rate of movement.
The object was described as smooth-surfaced and streamlined, resembling a C-54 from the rear but without visible motors or flying wings.
The sighting lasted only four minutes before the object disappeared from view due to its superior speed.
The Chief Pilot, Captain [redacted], was not known for exaggeration, lending credibility to the report.
sighted object: flying saucer larger than a C-54 aircraft
witnesses: Pilot and co-pilot of a commercial flying service
